intro: Lepidococca sieberi, commonly known as the silverleaf tree, is a deciduous tree native to the mountainous regions of China. It is characterized by its striking silvery-white undersides on its leaves, which give it its common name. The plant belongs to the family Ericaceae and is known for its ornamental value due to its unique foliage. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers cooler, moist climates. The tree produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, followed by dark blue berries.
